answers.answer: I heard that too much salt in ur diet can make u swell up like that. You should prob call ur OB and tell them also.I wake up every morning with the swollen feet too but if ur legs arent swollen also its prob no big deal.
Call your ob. Swelling, especially when it involves the face, is a sign of preeclampsia. If you can, check your blood pressure.  It can come on suddenly. I would get checked out just to be safe.
That is a definite sign of preeclampsia!  Go get checked out!
I have to agree go I n to the hospital to make sure everything s ok better safe then sorry.
Contact your Dr. It sounds like preeclampsia to me. I had it at 26 wks with my first and I had your symptoms. Pay attention to your blood pressure as well.

Once again thank you so much ladies. My doc had me come in to check my bloodpressure an it was slightly high. They sent me home with a machine so i can keep a close eye on it an told me if it gets any higher that i am to take myself into L&D. It really is better to be safe then sorry. Thank you again to you all for your advice.

question: I am 32+4 and woke up this morning with a lot of swelling in my hands, feet, ankles and face. This is my second pregnancy and i have been lucky enough to never have to deal with this. I had to use oil to get my wedding rings off and up until this morning they have always been a lil bit big on me. Is it normal to swell up like this since i haven't been up or gotten over heated at all? My feet feel like I'm walking on fluid filled pillows and the skin on my hands feel so tight like my fingers are going to pop. Has anyone had this happen over night?
title: advice please
